data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD to see a price correction in the short-term – ANZ
data.text: Gold trades near $1,930 as the weaker US Dollar continues to lend support. Economists at ANZ Bank expect a downside correction in the near term.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD correction could see a retest of the $1,900 barrier
data.text: Gold price returns to the red. As FXStreet's Dhwani Mehta notes, $1,940 is a tough nut to crack for XAU/USD bulls.

data.title: Gold Futures: Upside could take a breather
data.text: Open interest in gold futures markets shrank by nearly 2K contracts after three consecutive daily builds on Tuesday, according to preliminary prints from CME Group. Volume, instead, went up by the second straight session, now by around 42.8K contracts.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD retreats towards 10-DMA as yields portray market's anxiety
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) prints mild losses around $1,930 as it consolidates the gains marked during the last six consecutive weeks. That said, sluggish markets on early Wednesday joins the cautious mood ahead of the key US data/events, as well as technical formation, to tease the XAU/USD sellers after rising in the last two days in a row.

data.title: Gold Holds the High Ground as US Dollar Languishes. Where to for XAU/USD?
data.text: The gold price is pressing overnight highs as the US Dollar struggled to get a grip and CPI data revealed growing price pressures down under. How high can gold go?

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD looks to surpass $1,940 amid weaker yields, US GDP eyed
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) is aiming to overstep the immediate resistance of $1,940.00 in the Tokyo session. The precious metal is gaining strength amid rising demand for the US government bonds that have weakened yields further.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD bulls run out of steam amid mixed markets, rising wedge in focus
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) seesaws around $1,938 as bulls take a breather inside a bearish chart pattern during early Wednesday. In doing so, the bright metal depicts the market's mixed feelings amid downbeat data from the United States, as well as the cautious mood ahead of the next week's Federal Reserve (Fed) meeting.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD bulls are testing critical resistance, traders eye key events
data.text: The Gold price is making progress on the day into the final push on Wall Street and rallied from a low of $1,917.22 to a high of $1,942 on the day so far.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD drops beneath $1930 on better-than-expected US PMIs
data.text: Gold price struggles to continue its rally after hitting a new 9-month high at $1,942.51, retreats to the $1,930s area, as Wall Street prepares to open on a lower note. Factors like a risk-off impulse, and the greenback erasing earlier losses, weighs on the XAU/USD.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD could surge higher above $1,970 – TDS
data.text: Gold price touched a nine-month high on Tuesday. The yellow metal needs to surpass the $1,970 region to firm further, strategists at TD Securities report.

data.title: Gold Prices Power Ahead, Will XAU/USD Break $2,000 Soon?
data.text: The precious metal is testing a new multi-month high and with little in the way of resistance on the charts, gold may soon challenge $2,000/oz.

data.title: Gold Moving into Technical Resistance – Five Waves Up Can Cause a Slow Down
data.text: Gold came to new highs, but it's seen in late stages of a final fifth wave that belongs to an impulse from 1784, so we should be aware of a bearish reversal since we know that after every five waves new correction can show up. We can also see price now testing fifth wave Fib target at 1940 while RSI shows a divergence so there is s chance that bulls will slow down, especially if the USD will find some support now when US yields are turning slightly lower.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD bulls retain control near nine-month top, just below $1,950
data.text: Gold price builds on the previous day's modest uptick and gains some follow-through traction for the second successive day on Tuesday. The momentum pushes the XAU/USD to its highest level since April 22, around the $1,942-$1,943 region during the early European session, though lacks follow-through.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD bulls keep the reins beyond $1,917 – Confluence Detector
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) refreshes a nine-month high as it picks up bids to $1,940 during the initial hour of Tuesday's European session. In doing so, the bright metal cheers broad US Dollar weakness, as well as hopes of more demand from China, ahead of the monthly activity data.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD needs to break the $1,942 barrier for a fresh uptrend
data.text: Gold price is consolidating the latest uptick to near nine-month highs. XAU/USD eyes $1,942 and global PMIs for further upside, FXStreet's Dhwani Mehta reports.

data.title: Gold Futures: Rally appears unabated
data.text: Considering advanced prints from CME Group for gold futures markets, open interest went up for the third session in a row on Monday, this time by around 6.2K contracts. Volume followed suit and rose by around 34.2K contracts, keeping the erratic activity well in place for yet another session.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD retreats towards $1,920 key support amid sluggish sentiment, PMIs in focus
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) slides from the intraday high to $1,932 during early Tuesday morning in Europe. In doing so, the bullion price reacts to the latest challenges to sentiment amid an inactive market performance due to the lack of major data/events, as well as the absence of China traders and the Fed talks.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD bears eye a correction to break trendline supports
data.text: Gold price was volatile at the start of the week following a break of a test of a major trendline and horizontal support. In Asia, the bulls are extending the surge from the latter part of Monday's bullish correction and are taking up the $1,932s.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD aims for stability above $1,930 as risk-on solidifies, US PMI eyed
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) is looking to sustain above the immediate resistance of $1,930.00 in the early Tokyo session. The precious metal has extended its responsive buying action move from $1,912.50 to near $1,930.00 and is aiming to stretch further as the risk appetite of the market participants is firmer.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD trips down below $1920, on rising US bond yields
data.text: Gold price retraces from around daily highs hit at $1935.51 and drops beneath $1915 as US Treasury bond yields recover some ground and underpin the US Dollar (USD), although market sentiment remains upbeat. Therefore, the yellow metal remains lackluster, and the XAU/USD exchanges hands at around $1914.49, down by more than 0.60%.
